impressive in my book.﻿

comments.text:
I like Pascal, his fight against Froch was legendary! Pascal is an 
athletic, fast fighter with heart, good power and a great chin but imo I 
think Kovalev is much more powerful and is very accurate with his punches 
whilst Pascal is a bit wild in bursts and tends to leave himself open which 
I think Kovalev will take advantage of. I think Kovalev KO's Pascal round 
6.﻿

comments.text:

Kovalev is out of position. Something tells me that Kovalev is going to 
press for the knockout, which will work against him.﻿

comments.author: Noel Gill

comments.text:
kovalev beat Hopkins who was beaten by Dawson 2 years ago that Stevenson 
beat in 1 punch but Adonis already is a beaten man to most hummmm...Emanuel 
was a man of his word and knew a bunch about boxing. He was the most 
successfull trainer in the history of the sport and said adonis was one of 
the best natural fighter he ever saw. Many would say he was old, out of his 
mind and praised many other fighters at the time. Emanuel hosted stevenson 
in his house when he was in Detroit so i'm pretty sure he believed a lot in 
him. He is massively underrated it's not fair the guy as a 1 punch knockout 
like none , incredible reach of 77" for a 5'11 fighter is very unusual. His 
defense is pretty underrated and he is very ellusive. His straight punchs 
are no match to any fighter in my eyes because of that reach and power. He 
dosen't have a hook like Kovalev or a Prime Roy jones but He is fast 
accurate and strong . Way more agile than you may think. 1 left cross like 
he did to gonzales and it's over for any fighter. Kovalev might probably be 
the best and I respect him a lot as a boxer and a man. He is doing what 
every boxer should do fighting any fighter at any given time in any given 
place, you have to respect that.
 ﻿

comments.text:
Pascal will have to try to get inside because he is lower and his hands are 
shorter, but then he'll be countered by Kovalev. Pascal certainly has the 
balls to fight bravely, but his skills are obviously insufficient to beat 
Kovalev. When he jumps forward, it is well seen and he will hardly take 
Kovalev by surprise. I'd say Kovalev by UD or by TKO in later rounds.

Top 15 Boxers 2015:
1. Floyd Mayweather

comments.text:
Should be a great fight!
Kovolev just seems a bit meaner to me and likes fighting, plus he has 
cannon balls for fists. I think he'll be wanting a KO after going the 
distance with Hopkins, Pascal has a good chin though so i think it will be 
a long fight with a possible late stoppage or Kovolev  by a wide points 
win. Pascal won't outbox Kovalev so he'll need to be very aggressive and 
take chances and hope his home town support gives him energy, but taking 
chances against Kovalev is the best way to get KO'd!﻿
comments.author: TheMothman001

comments.text: +yobro250 Russians are good chess players
comments.author: Babatunde24

comments.text:
Kovalev isn't aggressive outside the ring....In fact he's pretty 
shy....Pascal is shy as well....Hopkins is someone who sees much more 
aggressive outside the ring....Look at all the stare-downs and faceoffs 
between Kovalev and Hopkins....Hopkins looked much more dominant and 
aggressive in every stare-down and Kovalev looked "beta"....not that it 
helped Bernard during the fight through as fighting and personality 
characteristics are not related....Having a more "alpha" personality 
doesn't mean much in a fighting sport like boxing or mma....Plenty of 
really shy  quiet guys have had great success in combat sports...and plenty 
of loud aggressive guys have been terrible at boxing/mma...
comments.author: yobro250

comments.text:
+Chuck Williams What's the use of his athleticism. He could not knock down 
Bute who was far from his best shape and since then Pascal has rusted from 
inaction; fighting once a year on average against weak opposition is not 
like fighting 3-4 times a year like Kovalev. Pascal is too predictable in 
what he does in the ring and his worrate is very low, he gasses badly in 
the second half, so what are his chances against Kovalev? Zero!

comments.text:
+Chuck Williams​ Nobody is as crafty, tough and experienced as B-Hop. 
That's for sure. But Kovalev was very smart in that fight, since he didn't 
allow Hopkins to work on the inside as he likes to. B-Hop himself said 
Kovalev has a tremendous talent and has a size advantage over Pascal. Let's 
see what happens... Anyway, you have to give him credit for taking on all 
the top guys in his division. I think that's what makes him a great champion
comments.author: Uriel Zinn

comments.text:
+Uriel Zinn Bhop 4 years ago isn't the same guy as today. But the only 
thing that hasn't changed is bhop's boxing IQ. Kovalev's boxing IQ isn't as 
high as Bhop's. Bhop is crafty and tough as nails. I think Roy Jones has 
channeled Pascal's energy into being an effective boxer and not a dumb 
boxer. Pascal has been in the ring with top tier guys so I think he knows 
what it takes to be champion at this level.
comments.author: Chuck Williams

comments.text:
+Chuck Williams Being athletic doesn't mean anything. He was too athletic 
for Hopkins too and he was embarrassed. The guy has stamina issues. Kovalev 
is the better boxer and he is smarter in the ring. That's what makes the 
difference at this level.
comments.author: Uriel Zinn

comments.text: He will lose to Pascal. Pascal is too athletic for Kovalev.
comments.author: Chuck Williams

comments.text:
If the Krusher keeps his distance and lands precision power shots here and 
there. The fight is over by rd 8 with Pascal's team stopping it or Jean 
getting KTFO!﻿
comments.author: Vavazelus

comments.text:
No one will get knocked out, this will go to a decision but I still don't 
know who's gonna win. I give the edge to Kovalev but Pascal, I won't count 
him out.﻿
comments.author: petpisrepet
